titleStmt.title: The queen-like closet; or, Rich cabinet stored with all manner of rare receipts for preserving, candying & cookery. Very pleasant and beneficial to all ingenious persons of the female sex. By Hannah Wolley.
titleStmt.author: Woolley, Hannah, fl. 1670.
Woolley, Hannah, fl. 1670. Second part of the queen-like closet.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for R. Lowndes at the White Lion in Duck-Lane, near West-Smithfield,

notesStmt.note: With an added engraved title page following A2.
A2 reads: Licensed, Nov. 16, 1669. Roger L'Estrange.
"The second part of the Queen-like closet" has a separate dated title page; pagination and register are continuous.
Includes an index to each part.
Copy tightly bound with slight loss of print; print show-through.

place.placeName: the White Lion in Duck-Lane, near West-Smithfield
